content: oma s sokken my oma dutch for grandmother was an amazing sock knitter and so is my mom who passed along her sock knitting skills to me back in my oma s time sock knitting would have been more of a necessity to keep her family s feet warm but today hand knit socks are a luxury everyone can enjoy whether you re an eager first-time sock knitter or a veteran sock knitter in need of a go-to easy- peasy sock pattern these are the perfect socks for you oma s sokken are knit in a traditional rib pattern which is not only simple but provides an amazingly comfy and snug fit too size approx foot circumference yarn adult small medium large allison barnes basic sock in flowers in your hair sand in your toes 7½ inches or 19 cm 8½ inches or 22 cm 9½ inches or 24 cm 80% superwash merino 20% nylon needles 379 m 420 yd 115 g 2 25 mm or us 1 double pointed needles notions set of 5 tapestry needle stitch marker s or your preferred needles for knitting in the round or on gauge 2 circular needles 32 stitches = approx 10 cm unblocked ___________________________________________________________________________ the pattern is written to be knit with dpns but can be adapted for knitting in the round or with 2 circular needles magic loop if that s your preferred method if you re knitting socks for the first time you may find knitting on circular needles the easiest especially if you have some experience knitting in the round there are a lot of excellent tutorials on youtube for reference no matter which method you use it may be helpful to use a stitch marker or progress keeper to mark the beginning of your round you can also place stitch markers after every 14 16 18 stitches to mimic the 4 needles referenced in this pattern note there is no further mention of stitch markers in this pattern so if you use them just slip them from needle to needle as you go along if you have some or a lot of experience knitting socks you can use this pattern as a guideline for heel flap and heel turn counts etc you know the not-so-fun math part of knitting and add your own flavour by using a twisted rib or broken rib cuff knitting a contrasting cuff heel and toe or by knitting a different heel flap or toe make them your own 2 © the kitchen sink shop ready to cast on let s go cast on 56 64 72 stitches using the long tail cast on method distribute evenly on 4 needles you should have 14 16 18 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches cuff k2 p2 for 15 rounds or longer if you like a longer cuff there s no right or wrong here leg of the sock all sizes round 1 *k3
